column1: Rural health care faces too many challenges normally and even more during the COVID crisis. Thank you @DepSecHargan for the opportunity to discuss future steps we can take to help rural providers and patients at yesterday's @HHSGov Rural Health roundtable during #RuralHealthWeek https://t.co/O364Uz9io9

Last week I hosted a series of Small Business & Community Roundtables where we discussed adapting to the current environment while taking steps to fight COVID-19. My column here: https://t.co/eg6Izt4t51
Great catching up with @NPChamber yesterday where we discussed priorities for the rest of the year the local economy and their efforts to combat COVID-19. #NE03 https://t.co/8VyKxXQzVC

Thank you to Burwell Community Memorial Health Center leadership for the update on your management of #COVID19 . I appreciated your thoughtful feedback on pandemic-related regulatory relief opportunities for long-term care facilities. #NE03 https://t.co/6uX50d7GNc

Great conversation yesterday with #GIAEDC leadership about ongoing development projects and how they have continued their efforts despite COVID-19 and how I can best support their efforts to grow Grand Island. #NE03 https://t.co/BKbq9G1yZm
Appreciated the opportunity to discuss the impact of COVID and direction of the economy with members of the Dundy County Chamber yesterday. #NE03 https://t.co/Hqa7dRBqIH
Thanks to Howard County Medical Center leadership for the productive feedback last week on COVID-19 response and other topics. #NE03 https://t.co/NjMG7nvGIJ

Thanks to @NebraskaCRNA for the hard work Nebraska Nurse Anesthetists have done on the health care frontlines. #CRNAs have been vital in responding to the COVID pandemic especially in rural areas like #NE03. https://t.co/Ve2s7T5Fy0

Vaccine development has been a top priority of our COVID response with Congress and @POTUS working together on several important actions made possible by the CARES Act. My column here: https://t.co/vw46lotSCs

Nebraska airports remain as critical as ever despite the challenges of COVID-19. For this reason I joined in introducing @SenatorFischer ‘s AIR Act in the House to provide needed relief for our airports. My release here: https://t.co/yG87ZbZohP

Great to join the @EthanolRFA Board meeting this week where we discussed efforts to tackle the #COVID19 challenges the biofuels industry is facing including trade and SREs. Getting back to the record demand for ethanol before the pandemic is a top priority. https://t.co/awNY1vu0Vh

Telehealth has been critical to our COVID response where patients can engage with their medical providers while limiting travel and the spread of the virus. Telehealth is a life-saving tool & I am excited to support this @WaysandMeansGOP discussion draft! https://t.co/Jd1Bad7OVZ

Republicans on the @WaysandMeansGOP have introduced solutions to spur innovation and help solve the COVID crisis and beyond. Recently @RepKevinBrady has unveiled the Faster Cures through Innovation Agenda – which has my full support. My column here: https://t.co/ZVmxC78xyc

Reminder: Due to the #COVID19 pandemic @USTreasury delayed #TaxDay to today. Double check to ensure you have filed your tax return. If you need more time you must still file for an extension by today. https://t.co/e8gb86LGR6
My weekly column>>>We continue to fight the health and economic effects of COVID-19 but we can’t forget our nation’s mounting debt: https://t.co/5aWQWObV5T
The COVID-19 pandemic hasn’t stopped work on beneficial agreements to boost our economy. My column here: https://t.co/0F53SgUUfc

While we continue working on COVID relief measures we cannot ignore the skyrocketing debt we are accumulating. I joined @reparrington in calling for deficit reduction as part of future pandemic legislation to ensure we are addressing fiscal repercussions. https://t.co/i9rtsAGBw1

Great to connect with the Nebraska Biodiesel Board this week. Ethanol was at record demands before #COVID19 and we must ensure our producers will be able to persevere this pandemic. Thank you for all you do! https://t.co/dpfpisu4fr

I appreciate @CSPAN for having me on this morning to discuss what the ongoing #COVID19 pandemic means for Nebraska and the measures we are taking to fight it. You can watch the full interview here: https://t.co/ZchxNUZMgx
While COVID-19 has affected all of us I am thankful we have technology to bridge the gap and keep us connected. My column here: https://t.co/B2KjgHMVFB
Speaker’s Pelosi’s $3 trillion bill full of partisan provisions will not defeat COVID-19 or restore our economy. I voted no. My statement: https://t.co/UFU4j9ceBj
COVID-19 has hit livestock producers particularly hard. They work overtime to feed our nation and deserve more than our thanks. My column here: https://t.co/cIbwcrsEP3

Much has changed in the four months since President Trump signed #USMCA into law back in December – not the least of which is the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. However what has not changed is the importance of this agreement. My column here: https://t.co/rC8NoGsPmG

Thank you #NE03 constituents who participated in my ag webinar this morning. Undersec. Ibach and @usdafsa Admin. Fordyce shared great info on @USDA programs for producers during the #COVID19 pandemic. If you missed it you can watch the full video here: : https://t.co/HuT3gTcDGb

Small businesses are the lifeblood of rural America and #PPP has been critical to keeping them afloat during this pandemic. My statement on supporting Phase 3.5 of the COVID-19 response: https://t.co/Oc0QbkOp3L

Rural community hospitals are doing their part to fight COVID-19. To help them in this fight @repterrisewell @RepArrington and I introduced a bill to include them in PPP. My release here: https://t.co/AAQ9GmulJQ

America relies on our farmers and ranchers to provide a strong safe and stable food supply. In the current #COVID19 situation their importance is even more obvious. My column here: https://t.co/oq9wjTYZqY

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19 Tuesday’s Service Academy Open House at the Gering Public Library is postponed. For assistance with the academy nomination process please contact my Grand Island office. #ne03 https://t.co/oLaRA1LjbX

While we continue the fight this #COVID19 we must also be sure to not let our guard down against fraud. Recently there have been numerous reports of scams taking advantage of this pandemic. My column here: https://t.co/a7DBBV5D0b

Nebraskans have taken drastic but necessary measures to stop the spread of COVID-19 and it is clear a major disaster declaration is appropriate. I appreciate the leadership of @GovRicketts and @POTUS at this difficult time. My statement here: https://t.co/Q2QWM4ZaHv

Despite the crucial role our cattle producers play in feeding our nation during #COVID19 they are now having to weather low prices and market volatility. Because of this I wrote to @USDA urging immediate assistance for cattle producers. My statement here: https://t.co/5YteTR6wQa

Technologies such as #telehealth are critical to providing Medicare beneficiaries health care access while preventing unnecessary risks to those most vulnerable. Because of this @RepOHalleran and I led a letter supporting telehealth in the #COVID19 package. https://t.co/r3UKXvGeja

Today on #NationalAgDay we owe our ag producers a great deal of thanks for all they do to feed the world. During the #COVID19 outbreak we have seen first-hand the importance of food production and how much we rely on our producers. Thank you!

While the COVID-19 outbreak continues drastic measures have been put in place to slow the spread. Due to the seriousness of this issue @POTUS has taken actions to keep us safe. My column here:  https://t.co/rR3KhoCGKO

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19 the upcoming public events in Hebron Falls City Geneva Pawnee City and Arthur have been postponed. Please contact my office via https://t.co/DUWpuzCTAS if you need assistance or to share your concerns. #NE03 https://t.co/rbEBvZc5HU

Thank you @realDonaldTrump for cutting red tape for ethanol producers to make alcohol for much-needed hand sanitizer and for motor carriers who are transporting essential supplies and equipment.  Rural America stands ready to help fight #COVID19.

New alert from @SocialSecurity Inspector General - While SSA is providing telephone service only due to COVID-19 any claims of a benefit cut because of Coronavirus are a scam. More info here - https://t.co/Uzqx2j6meq

Because of the COVID-19 national emergency Treasury has deferred tax payment deadlines by 90 days.  This deadline only applies to payments – the tax filing deadline remains April 15.  More info here: https://t.co/PcMj3AF9mq

Reminder – Veterans who believe they are experiencing COVID-19 symptoms should contact their local VA health facility by telephone not immediately go there in person. More Coronavirus info for veterans can be found here: https://t.co/KsXI1xN3gz

Americans are rightfully taking steps to protect themselves their families friends and neighbors from transmission of #coronavirus and I am grateful for the leadership of @realDonaldTrump during this trying time. My column here:  https://t.co/QlUnoSoNBT
.@POTUS has released important recommendations for slowing the spread of COVID-19.  Please read and stay safe!  https://t.co/JJ7Sni0Eka

Due to health and safety concerns with COVID-19 Saturday’s Service Academy Open House at @kearneylib is postponed. For assistance with the academy nomination process please contact my Grand Island office.  #NE03 https://t.co/oioX1UlLIS

Due to health & safety concerns with COVID-19 along with recommendation of social distancing from @POTUS @GovRicketts @CDCgov & out of an abundance of caution my office will be postponing tomorrow’s Staff Mobile Office in Kimball. #NE03 https://t.co/mqHyxkNZye

. @POTUS has been adamant from the very beginning we must take #coronavirus seriously. The package we passed today in the House will be critical to preventing the spread of this disease. My statement here: https://t.co/F6ivpyiLDX

At today’s @WaysandMeansGOP hearing I asked @SecAzar about the administration’s response to the #coronavirus and discussed the key role @unmc plays in efforts to combat this virus. Watch my remarks here: https://t.co/M389gYeDsz
